summary: Thousands of facilities use hazardous chemicals, and hundreds of them are subject to both Department of Homeland Security anti-terrorism standards and other federal chemical safety or security programs. We reviewed 8 such programs and compared them to DHS's standards. We found some overlap, duplication, and fragmentation. title: Chemical Security: Overlapping Programs Could Better Collaborate to Share Information and Identify Potential Security Gaps
